features.name: Average length of stemmed text
features.explanation:
This feature describes the average length of stemmed text.

Stemming is a form of text normalizationwhere text dimensionality is reduced.

features.name: Number of infobox images
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of images inside the infobox of the article

features.name: Number of main article templates
features.explanation: This feature describes number of used main article templates. This template includes a link to an article with the subtopic before the subtopic is summarized in the main article.

features.name: Number of links to same category articles
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of links to other Wikipedia articles that have a similar topic and thus belong to the same category.
This feature describes the number of used citation templates, last visited: 29. June 2021, 12:25}. Citation templates are used to generate citations for books, web pages or other references.

features.name: Number of citation needed templates
features.explanation: The number of used citation needed templates. This template is used to make annotations in the article where citations are missing. After the sentence in question it says [citation needed].

features.name: Number of images
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of images in an article excluding the images from the infobox.

features.name: Number of infobox templates
features.explanation: This feature describes the number of infobox templates. Infoboxes are used for a brief overview of details and there is normally just one.

features.name: Number of characters in paragraphs without ref
features.explanation: This feature describes

features.name: Number of shortened footnote templates
features.explanation: This feature describes the number of used shortened footnote (sfn) templates. This template creates a author and date citation in a footnote. It can be used to combine identical citations.

features.name: Number of who templates
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of used who templates. This template is used to make annotations in the article where a person should be specified. After the word in question it says [who?].

features.name: Idioms
features.explanation: This feature describes

features.name: Number of Words to watch
features.explanation: This feature describes

features.name: Number of words
features.explanation: This feature describes the number of words in the article.

features.name: Number of characters
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of characters in the entire article.

features.name: Number of characters in content
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of characters in the content part of the article.

features.name: Number of external links
features.explanation: This feature describes the number of links leading to external websites in the article.

features.name: Number of sections
features.explanation:
This feature describes the number of sections in an article. In Wikipedia, these are the 2nd level headings.

More sections influence the prediction positively.

features.name: Number of subsections
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of subsections in the article.

features.name: Reftags
features.explanation: This feature describes

features.name: Number of all templates
features.explanation: This feature describes the number of all templates used in the article.

features.name: Links to other articles
features.explanation: This feature describes the amount of links leading to other Wikipedia pages in the content part of the article. This excludes links inside of templates.
